intro: Borreria saturejifolia, commonly known as the Mexican germander, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Borreria saturejifolia is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
